title: What is the relationship between Koreans and Mongolians? - Quora

response.answer_text: Currently, the relationship is like a big gift box.  In many people's words, we can not recognize each other as foreigners unless we speak. Sometimes, the relationship is called as ‘fraternal twins’. Mongolians and Koreans: Twins With Minimal Sibling RivalryMongolia was the country that showed the most authentic effort in reconciliation between South Korea and North Korea, as a country. [Mongolia: Potential Mediator between the Koreas and Proponent of Peace in Northeast Asia] It is famous that the Mongolian President made a strong criticism in his address to the top executives of North Korea. It was a criticism of the closureism and the laziness of reconciliation with South Korea. http://english.hani.co.kr/arti/english_edition/e_northkorea/611452.htmlMany Koreans go sightseeing in Mongolia and Mongolians come to South Korea to work. 1% of Mongolia's population is in South Korea. Mongolians in South Korea - Wikipedia. And 3,500 South Koreans resides in Mongolia. Both people commonly tell the advantage to the counntry as “It’s comfortable to live in. I’m not treated as a foreigner till when I speak something.” It’s famous that one of the most famous musicians in South Korea, ‘Akdong Musician(‘Bad kids musicians’)’, spent their childhood in Mongolia. Many Korean history amateurs want to study the geography of Mongolia. Nun River, Shiramuren River and has become increasingly familiar name. Mongolia is often perceived as a place of the environment where some Koreans of northern origin lived before they lived on a small peninsula. Many South Korean Christian missionaries acts in Mongolia. Parents of Akdong musiciann were also Christian missionaries. Some South Koreans try to increase or find the cultural common parts between two nations. In these efforts, South Koreans treat Mongolians as somewhat brother who, departed each other long time ago and doesn’t have records between them.For South Korea, Mongolia, like Hong Kong, is a country with only good relations and good feeling. For Mongolia, South Korea is an important reference for foreign policy and economic development in Mongolia.

Modern Mongolia was a land of Turkic people for thousand of years . Most of Mongolian mountains and rivers has a Turkic name . Only in Genghis khan era , Mongolians pushed Turkic people out of Mongolia . Ancestors of Mongols and Koreans were neighbors for long time . Modern Koreans=Native Korean peninsula people+Korean speakers from Lake Baikal . Genetically Mongolians have more Korean gene than Chinese . 2nd century BC . Look at that Proto-Mongols (Donghu,Shiwei,Xianbei,Wuhuan) live close to north Koreans (Buyeo,Yemaek) . Genghis khan and his Borijigin ruling clan has its origin in Shiwei . Around 6th century they moved to Eastern Mongolia .   As other people stated , Mongolians favored Koreans over Chinese during Yuan dynasty . There was a legend that Genghis khan was distracted by Korean woman beauty while staying in China . Also Yuan dynasty’s last king Toghon Temur had Korean queen Empress Ki . Later she became Grand Empress . Their son Biligtu Khan became emperor of northern Yuan dynasty .
